DOC.brief_title: Evaluating Pain Outcomes Ketorolac Administration Children Undergoing Circumcision
DOC.detailed_description: Prospective , randomize , single-blinded study conduct January 2017- December 2017 . A total two group present . Patients plan circumcision surgery initially identify surgeon . Patients randomized treatment ( perioperative ketorolac ) control group ( ketorolac ) . A computer-generated randomized block design program use allocate patient either treatment ( ketorolac ) control ( ketorolac ) group . All child receive 15 mg/kg oral dose acetaminophen prior surgery unless contraindicate . General anesthesia induce sevoflurane via facemask . After establish venous access , laryngeal mask insert , anesthesia maintain 1 minimum alveolar anesthetic concentration ( MAC ) sevoflurane oxygen/air 50/50 mixture . The DPNB nerve block perform pediatric urologist use 23 GA needle insert Buck fascia . Once needle tip position appropriately , negative aspiration test , 0.2mL/kg ( maximum 10mL ) 0.25 % bupivacaine inject small aliquot , intermittent aspiration throughout . In patient , skin incision perform least 5 min placement nerve block . At begin circumcision procedure patient asleep , patient treatment group receive 0.5 mg/kg intravenous dose ketorolac . Patients advise take ibuprofen acetaminophen post-operatively need . Patients ' demographic information , time need perform block , time block onset duration surgery record . The mean arterial pressure , heart rate oxygen saturation , expire sevoflurane end tidal concentration MAC systematically collect pre-operatively , intra-operatively post-operatively recovery room . The usage two scale perform deemed appropriate research assistant . The FLACC scale use child difficulty verbalize pain sleep child ( regardless age ) Wong-Baker FACES scale use patient capable self-assessment . The FLACC score well-established postoperative pain measure use 5 item score 0-2 , validate patient 6 month 7 year age ( 9.10 ) . The Wong-Baker FACES pain scale use post-operatively allows patient select face relate current feeling pain ( 11 ) . These face rat scale 10 . A FLACC Wong-Baker FACES score record every 15 minute first hour every 30 minute 2 hour follow discharge PACU day stay surgical unit . If score find > 3 ( moderate pain 4-6 , severe pain 7-10 ) , patient receive intravenous morphine dose 0.05mg/kg . An additional dose may give 15 minute follow initial dose morphine analgesia inadequate ( score > 4 ) . Postoperatively , child monitor every 15 minute first hour every 30 minute next 2 hour discharge home . Discharge base normal institutional criterion include level awareness , hemodynamic stability absence pain , bleeding , nausea vomiting . Prior discharge , parent provide additional analgesic require home contact 24 hour follow surgery complete parent ' postoperative pain measure ( PPPM ) ( 12 ) . The PPPM well-established post-operative pain assessment tool high inter-rater reliability construct validity , design specifically use parent post-operative care child .
